ETYMOLOGY: From Old English hīehþu, hēahþu, from hēah 'high' (see high) + the suffix -þu (compare width, length).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The measurement of something from base to top or from head to foot.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某物从底部到顶部或从头到脚的尺寸；高度。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: What's the height of the Eiffel Tower?
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 埃菲尔铁塔的高度是多少？

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The distance above a stated level, especially above the ground or sea level.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 高于某个特定水平面（尤其是地面或海平面）的距离；高空。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The plane flew at a height of 10,000 meters.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The most intense or extreme point of something; a peak or climax.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某事物的最强烈或最极端的点；高峰或高潮。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The party was at the height of its revelry when the police arrived.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 警察赶到时，派对正值狂欢的高潮。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A high place or area. (Often used in plural 'heights' to refer to elevated ground.)
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 高处或高地。（常以复数 'heights' 指代高地。）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He fell from a great height.

REGISTER: Common in everyday conversation, scientific descriptions, and literary contexts.
